release.action: fix leak when unlinking an entry from a directory
don't generate LFN entries for 8.3 names
fixed unit tests depending on dosfsck when the binary is not available
fixed off-by-one error when seeking in files
fixed not being able to read volumes freshly formatted by Windows 7, because we expected the free cluster count from the FS info sector to match the actual value (it does not have to)
fixed SuperFloppyFormatter? suggesting FAT16 for devices around 4 MiB size, which is in fact too small for FAT16
fixed a possible NPE when setting the volume label
fixed problems generating canonical file names when no LFN entries are present
fixed the boot sector copy for FAT32 filesystems being invalid
fixed clipping cluster numbers to 16 bits when using FAT32
the FAT archive, hidden, read-only and system attributes are now accessible through the FatLfnDirectoryEntry class
the restrictions for "unique" file names as required by the FAT specs are honored
it is possible to efficiently rename or move files and directories without doing a copy/delete cycle
fixed a memory leak when deleting directories
first version available through the Maven Central repository
rather big cleanup for the boot sector generation, which is no longer based on a blueprint which gets the correct values patched in but rather generated from scratch
fixed handling of the "." and ".." entries
first released version capable of reading and writing FAT 12/16/32 file systems (to some extent...)
